main event: A bright light was observed in the sky near Cleveland, Ohio on April 20, 1961.
interesting points: The light was described as very bright, round, and remaining stationary for a few seconds before disappearing in an instant.
The Air Force concluded this sighting was probably aircraft or astronomical in nature.
A separate sighting on April 30 in Cleveland described a larger object that started turning and had small bright objects appear underneath it before disappearing.
The observer estimated the object's size to be around 6 degrees and said it resembled an elongated oval balloon.
The object was observed for about 5 minutes and disappeared behind a building.
sighted object: a bright light, and a larger object described as an elongated oval balloon
witnesses: one adult male witness in each case
